alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 11 at 9:00PM MDT until April 13 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 9 PM MDT TUESDAY FOR THE MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY, CENTRAL TO NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS AND EASTERN PLAINS BELOW ANY SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WIND, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR MUCH OF WEST CENTRAL, CENTRAL AND EASTERN NEW MEXICO DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY... .Very strong to potentially damaging wind gusts to around 65 or 70 mph are then possible Tuesday along and east of the central mountain chain as well as over portions of northwest and west central NM. Critical fire weather conditions on Tuesday are expected to be concentrated along and east of the Middle Rio Grande Valley where relative humidity will be lowest. While temperatures will be cooler than normal Wednesday, extremely dry conditions with widespread and long duration single digit relative humidity values will be combined with strong wind speeds. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 9 PM MDT TUESDAY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Highlands and Sandia, Manzano and Gallinas Mountains below any snowpack, Northeast and East Central Plains, Middle Rio Grande Valley. Critical conditions will persist through mid evening. Stronger and possibly damaging winds are expected Tuesday with critical conditions forecast from mid morning through mid evening Tuesday. Critical conditions redevelop Wednesday morning and continue through the early evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest to west 30 to 45 mph with gusts to 65 mph Tuesday. West 25 to 35 mph with gusts to 45 mph Wednesday afternoon. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...10 to 15 percent Tuesday and 4 to 8 percent Wednesday. * IMPACTS....Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains
